meanings.definition: The exercise of absolute power, especially in a cruel and oppressive way.
meanings.sent1: The despotism of the king made the people live in fear.
meanings.sent2: The country suffered under the despotism of the dictator.
meanings.sent3: The despotism of the principal over the students was not appreciated.
meanings.sent4: The despotism of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The despotism of the traffic lights controlled the flow of cars.

meanings.definition: A government or political system in which a ruler has unlimited power.
meanings.sent1: The citizens revolted against the despotism of the tyrant.
meanings.sent2: The history books were filled with tales of despotism in ancient empires.
meanings.sent3: The despotism of the cat over the house was evident in its demanding meows for food.
meanings.sent4: The despotism of time marches on, regardless of our wishes.
meanings.sent5: The despotism of the sun ruled over the sky, casting its light on all below.
